          • text equals 'vagrant:!!:19501:0:99999:'
          • line equals 'vagrant:!!:19501:0:99999:'
          • subexpression equals '99999'
          Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
          subexpression
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:20201 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Root password in /etc/shadow does not have a maximum password age of 0 or greater than 60
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          State Operator:All item-state comparisons must be true.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:20202 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/shadow'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^root:[^:]*:[^:]*:[^:]*:(\d+):'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:20200 (textfilecontent54_state)

          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be greater than '0'

          subexpression
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:20202 (textfilecontent54_test)

          Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:20203 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:

            • text matches the pattern '^polkitd'
            • text matches the pattern '^root'
            • text matches the pattern '^shutdown'
            • text matches the pattern '^sshd'
            • text matches the pattern '^sync'
            • text matches the pattern '^systemd-coredump'
            • text matches the pattern '^systemd-resolve'
            • text matches the pattern '^tss'
            • text matches the pattern '^unbound'
            • text matches the pattern '^vboxadd'
          Exclude Items If:
          • text matches the pattern '^nobody'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:20203 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:true
          Title:Root does not have a blank entry in /etc/shadow for maximum password age
          Check Existence:No collected items may exist.

          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/shadow'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^root:[^:]*:[^:]*:[^:]*::'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

          V-248699 - OL 8 passwords must have a minimum of 15 characters.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248699r858645_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-020230
          Identities:CCI-000205 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (i); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
          Description: Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks. Password length is one factor of several that helps to determine strength and how long it takes to crack a password. Use of more characters in a password helps to increase exponentially the time and/or resources required to compromise the password.

          OL 8 uses "pwquality" as a mechanism to enforce password complexity. Configurations are set in the "etc/security/pwquality.conf" file.

          The "minlen", sometimes noted as minimum length, acts as a "score" of complexity based on the credit components of the "pwquality" module. By setting the credit components to a negative value, not only will those components be required, but they will not count toward the total "score" of "minlen". This will enable "minlen" to require a 15-character minimum. false
          Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to enforce a minimum 15-character password length.

          Add or update the following line in the "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" file or a configuration file in the "/etc/security/pwquality.conf.d/" directory:

          minlen = 15

          Remove any configurations that conflict with the above value.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Oracle Linux 8
          Identifier:5416
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:204
          Result:false
          Title:OL08-00-020230 - OL 8 passwords must have a minimum of 15 characters.
          Description:Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks. Password length is one factor of several that helps to determine strength and how long it takes to crack a password. Use of more characters in a password helps to increase exponentially the time and/or resources required to compromise the password.

          OL 8 uses "pwquality" as a mechanism to enforce password complexity. Configurations are set in the "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" file.

          The "minlen", sometimes noted as minimum length, acts as a "score" of complexity based on the credit components of the "pwquality" module. By setting the credit components to a negative value, not only will those components be required, but they will not count toward the total "score" of "minlen". This will enable "minlen" to require a 15-character minimum.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (passwords must have a minimum of 15 characters)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:20400 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:passwords must have a minimum of 15 characters
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:20402 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • Collect any available items.
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:20400 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be greater than or equal to '15'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-248700 - OL 8 passwords for new users must have a minimum of 15 characters.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248700r779666_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-020231
          Identities:CCI-000205 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (i); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
          Description: The shorter the password, the lower the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised.

          Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks. Password length is one factor of several that helps to determine strength and how long it takes to crack a password. Use of more characters in a password helps to increase exponentially the time and/or resources required to compromise the password.

          The DoD minimum password requirement is 15 characters. false
          Fix Text:Configure operating system to enforce a minimum 15-character password length for new user accounts.

          Add or modify the following line in the "/etc/login.defs" file:

          PASS_MIN_LEN 15
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Oracle Linux 8
          Identifier:5416
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:205
          Result:false
          Title:OL08-00-020231 - OL 8 passwords for new users must have a minimum of 15 characters.
          Description:The shorter the password, the lower the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised.

          Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks. Password length is one factor of several that helps to determine strength and how long it takes to crack a password. Use of more characters in a password helps to increase exponentially the time and/or resources required to compromise the password.

          The DoD minimum password requirement is 15 characters.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/login.defs: PASS_MIN_LEN = 15 or greater)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:20500 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/login.defs: PASS_MIN_LEN = 15 or greater
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:20500 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/login.defs'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*PASS_MIN_LEN\s+(\d+)\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:20500 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be greater than or equal to '15'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ false ]
          • filepath equals '/etc/login.defs'
          • path equals '/etc'
          • filename equals 'login.defs'
          • pattern equals '^\s*PASS_MIN_LEN\s+(\d+)\s*$'
          • instance equals '1'
          • text equals 'PASS_MIN_LEN 5'
          • line equals 'PASS_MIN_LEN 5'
          • subexpression equals '5'
          Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
          subexpression

          V-248705 - The OL 8 lastlog command must have a mode of "0750" or less permissive.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248705r779681_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-020262
          Identities:CCI-001314 (NIST SP 800-53: SI-11 c; NIST SP 800-53A: SI-11.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-11 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SI-11 b)
          Description: Unauthorized disclosure of the contents of the /var/log/lastlog file can reveal system data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality. false
          Fix Text:Configure the mode of the "lastlog" command for OL 8 to "0750" with the following command:

          $ sudo chmod 0750 /usr/bin/lastlog
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0

          V-248711 - OL 8 must prevent the use of dictionary words for passwords.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248711r858649_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-020300
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: If OL 8 allows the user to select passwords based on dictionary words, this increases the chances of password compromise by increasing the opportunity for successful guesses and brute-force attacks. false
          Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to prevent the use of dictionary words for passwords.

          Add or update the following line in the "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" file or a configuration file in the "/etc/security/pwquality.conf.d/" directory:

          dictcheck=1

          Remove any configurations that conflict with the above value.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Oracle Linux 8
          Identifier:5416
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:211
          Result:false
          Title:OL08-00-020300 - OL 8 must prevent the use of dictionary words for passwords.
          Description:If OL 8 allows the user to select passwords based on dictionary words, this increases the chances of password compromise by increasing the opportunity for successful guesses and brute-force attacks.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (dictcheck is set to 1 in /etc/security/pwquality.conf or /etc/security/pwquality.conf.d/.)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:21100 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:dictcheck is set to 1 in /etc/security/pwquality.conf or /etc/security/pwquality.conf.d/.
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:21102 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • Collect any available items.
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:21100 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-248712 - OL 8 must enforce a delay of at least four seconds between logon prompts following a failed logon attempt.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248712r779702_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-020310
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: Configuring the operating system to implement organization-wide security implementation guides and security checklists verifies compliance with federal standards and establishes a common security baseline across the DoD that reflects the most restrictive security posture consistent with operational requirements.

          Configuration settings are the set of parameters that can be changed in hardware, software, or firmware components of the system that affect the security posture and/or functionality of the system. Security-related parameters are parameters impacting the security state of the system, including the parameters required to satisfy other security control requirements. Security-related parameters include, for example, registry settings; account, file, and directory permission settings; and settings for functions, ports, protocols, services, and remote connections. false
          Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to enforce a delay of at least four seconds between logon prompts following a failed console logon attempt.

          Modify the "/etc/login.defs" file to set the "FAIL_DELAY" parameter to "4" or greater:

          FAIL_DELAY 4
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Oracle Linux 8
          Identifier:5416
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:212
          Result:false
          Title:OL08-00-020310 - OL 8 must enforce a delay of at least four seconds between logon prompts following a failed logon attempt.
          Description:Configuring the operating system to implement organization-wide security implementation guides and security checklists verifies compliance with federal standards and establishes a common security baseline across the DoD that reflects the most restrictive security posture consistent with operational requirements.

          Configuration settings are the set of parameters that can be changed in hardware, software, or firmware components of the system that affect the security posture and/or functionality of the system. Security-related parameters are parameters impacting the security state of the system, including the parameters required to satisfy other security control requirements. Security-related parameters include, for example, registry settings; account, file, and directory permission settings; and settings for functions, ports, protocols, services, and remote connections.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/login.defs: FAIL_DELAY = 4 or greater)

          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:21200 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/login.defs'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*FAIL_DELAY\s+(\d+)\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-248718 - OL 8 must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon an SSH logon.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248718r858584_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-020350
          Identities:CCI-000052 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-9)
          Description: Providing users with feedback on when account accesses via SSH last occurred facilitates user recognition and reporting of unauthorized account use. false
          Fix Text:Configure SSH to provide users with feedback on when account accesses last occurred by setting the required configuration options in "/etc/pam.d/sshd" or in the "sshd_config" file used by the system ("/etc/ssh/sshd_config" will be used in the example). Note that this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor.

          Modify the "PrintLastLog" line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" to match the following:

          PrintLastLog yes

          The SSH service must be restarted for changes to "sshd_config" to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Oracle Linux 8
          Identifier:5416
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:214
          Result:false
          Title:OL08-00-020350 - OL 8 must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon an SSH logon.
          Description:Providing users with feedback on when account accesses via SSH last occurred facilitates user recognition and reporting of unauthorized account use.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/ssh/sshd_config:PrintLastLog == yes)
          Tests:

          Result:false
          Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config:PrintLastLog == yes
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)PrintLastLog(?-i)[ \t]+([\w\"]+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(yes|"yes")$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-248719 - OL 8 default permissions must be defined in such a way that all authenticated users can read and modify only their own files.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248719r779723_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-020351
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: Setting the most restrictive default permissions ensures that when new accounts are created, they do not have unnecessary access. false
          Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to define the default permissions for all authenticated users in such a way that the user can read and modify only their own files.

          Edit the "UMASK" parameter in the "/etc/login.defs" file to match the example below:

          UMASK 077

          V-248722 - The OL 8 audit system must be configured to audit the execution of privileged functions and prevent all software from executing at higher privilege levels than users executing the software.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248722r853794_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-030000
          Identities:CCI-002233 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (8); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (8))
          CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
          Description: Misuse of privileged functions, either intentionally or unintentionally by authorized users, or by unauthorized external entities that have compromised information system accounts, is a serious and ongoing concern and can have significant adverse impacts on organizations. Auditing the use of privileged functions is one way to detect such misuse and identify the risk from insider threats and the advanced persistent threat.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000326-GPOS-00126, SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127 false
          Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to audit the execution of the "execve" system call.

          Add or update the following file system rules to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S execve -C uid!=euid -F key=execpriv
          -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S execve -C uid!=euid -F key=execpriv

          -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S execve -C gid!=egid -F key=execpriv
          -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S execve -C gid!=egid -F key=execpriv

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

          $ sudo service auditd restart
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Oracle Linux 8
          Identifier:5416
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:216
          Result:false
          Title:OL08-00-030000 - The OL 8 audit system must be configured to audit the execution of privileged functions and prevent all software from executing at higher privilege levels than users executing the software.
          Description:Misuse of privileged functions, either intentionally or unintentionally by authorized users, or by unauthorized external entities that have compromised information system accounts, is a serious and ongoing concern and can have significant adverse impacts on organizations. Auditing the use of privileged functions is one way to detect such misuse and identify the risk from insider threats and the advanced persistent threat.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000326-GPOS-00126, SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of execve comparing UIDs.)
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of execve comparing UIDs.)
            • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of execve comparing GIDs.)
            • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of execve comparing GIDs.)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:21600 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit 32-bit invocations of execve comparing UIDs.
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:21600 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • for pattern, the following must be true:
            • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+arch=b32\s+(?:-S\s+[,\w]+\s+)*-S\s+[,\w]*\bexecve\b[,\w]*\s+(?:-S\s+[,\w]+\s+)*-C\s+uid!=euid(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:21601 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit 64-bit invocations of execve comparing UIDs.
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:21601 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • for pattern, the following must be true:
            • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+arch=b64\s+(?:-S\s+[,\w]+\s+)*-S\s+[,\w]*\bexecve\b[,\w]*\s+(?:-S\s+[,\w]+\s+)*-C\s+uid!=euid(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:21602 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit 32-bit invocations of execve comparing GIDs.
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:21602 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • for pattern, the following must be true:
            • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+arch=b32\s+(?:-S\s+[,\w]+\s+)*-S\s+[,\w]*\bexecve\b[,\w]*\s+(?:-S\s+[,\w]+\s+)*-C\s+gid!=egid(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:21603 (textfilecontent54_test)

          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-248724 - The OL 8 System Administrator (SA) and Information System Security Officer (ISSO) (at a minimum) must be alerted of an audit processing failure event.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248724r779738_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-030020
          Identities:CCI-000139 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-5 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-5.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-5 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-5 a)
          Description: It is critical for the appropriate personnel to be aware if a system is at risk of failing to process audit logs as required. Without this notification, the security personnel may be unaware of an impending failure of the audit capability, and system operation may be adversely affected.

          Audit processing failures include software/hardware errors, failures in the audit capturing mechanisms, and audit storage capacity being reached or exceeded.

          This requirement applies to each audit data storage repository (i.e., distinct information system component where audit records are stored), the centralized audit storage capacity of organizations (i.e., all audit data storage repositories combined), or both. false
          Fix Text:Configure the "auditd" service to notify the SA and ISSO in the event of an audit processing failure.

          Edit the following line in "/etc/audit/auditd.conf" to ensure that administrators are notified via email for those situations:

          action_mail_acct = root
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Oracle Linux 8
          Identifier:5416
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:217
          Result:false

          Description:It is critical for the appropriate personnel to be aware if a system is at risk of failing to process audit logs as required. Without this notification, the security personnel may be unaware of an impending failure of the audit capability, and system operation may be adversely affected.

          Audit processing failures include software/hardware errors, failures in the audit capturing mechanisms, and audit storage capacity being reached or exceeded.

          This requirement applies to each audit data storage repository (i.e., distinct information system component where audit records are stored), the centralized audit storage capacity of organizations (i.e., all audit data storage repositories combined), or both.
          Class:compliance

          • false (All child checks must be true.)

          V-248726 - The OL 8 System must take appropriate action when an audit processing failure occurs.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248726r779744_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-030040
          Identities:CCI-000140 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-5 b; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-5.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-5 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-5 b)
          Description: It is critical for the appropriate personnel to be aware if a system is at risk of failing to process audit logs as required. Without this notification, the security personnel may be unaware of an impending failure of the audit capability, and system operation may be adversely affected.

          Audit processing failures include software/hardware errors, failures in the audit capturing mechanisms, and audit storage capacity being reached or exceeded.

          This requirement applies to each audit data storage repository (i.e., distinct information system component where audit records are stored), the centralized audit storage capacity of organizations (i.e., all audit data storage repositories combined), or both. false
          Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to shut down by default upon audit failure (unless availability is an overriding concern).

          Add or update the following line ("disk_error_action" can be set to "SYSLOG" or "SINGLE" depending on configuration) in the "/etc/audit/auditd.conf" file:

          disk_error_action = HALT

          If availability has been determined to be more important, and this decision is documented with the ISSO, configure OL 8 to notify system administration staff and ISSO staff in the event of an audit processing failure by setting the "disk_error_action" to "SYSLOG".
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Oracle Linux 8
          Identifier:5416
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:218
          Result:false
          Title:OL08-00-030040 - The OL 8 System must take appropriate action when an audit processing failure occurs.
          Description:It is critical for the appropriate personnel to be aware if a system is at risk of failing to process audit logs as required. Without this notification, the security personnel may be unaware of an impending failure of the audit capability, and system operation may be adversely affected.

          Audit processing failures include software/hardware errors, failures in the audit capturing mechanisms, and audit storage capacity being reached or exceeded.

          This requirement applies to each audit data storage repository (i.e., distinct information system component where audit records are stored), the centralized audit storage capacity of organizations (i.e., all audit data storage repositories combined), or both.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audit/auditd.conf: disk_error_action = SYSLOG, SINGLE, or HALT)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:21800 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audit/auditd.conf: disk_error_action = SYSLOG, SINGLE, or HALT
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:21800 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '(?i)^\s*disk_error_action\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:21800 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^syslog$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:21801 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^single$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:21802 (textfilecontent54_state)

          V-248728 - The OL 8 audit system must take appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248728r779750_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-030060
          Identities:CCI-000140 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-5 b; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-5.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-5 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-5 b)
          Description: It is critical that when OL 8 is at risk of failing to process audit logs as required, it takes action to mitigate the failure. Audit processing failures include software/hardware errors; failures in the audit capturing mechanisms; and audit storage capacity being reached or exceeded. Responses to audit failure depend on the nature of the failure mode.

          When availability is an overriding concern, other approved actions in response to an audit failure are as follows:

          1) If the failure was caused by the lack of audit record storage capacity, OL 8 must continue generating audit records if possible (automatically restarting the audit service if necessary) and overwriting the oldest audit records in a first-in-first-out manner.

          2) If audit records are sent to a centralized collection server and communication with this server is lost or the server fails, OL 8 must queue audit records locally until communication is restored or until the audit records are retrieved manually. Upon restoration of the connection to the centralized collection server, action should be taken to synchronize the local audit data with the collection server. false
          Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to shut down by default upon audit failure (unless availability is an overriding concern).

          Add or update the following line ("disk_full_action" can be set to "SYSLOG" or "SINGLE" depending on configuration) in the "/etc/audit/auditd.conf" file:

          disk_full_action = HALT

          If availability has been determined to be more important, and this decision is documented with the ISSO, configure OL 8 to notify system administration staff and ISSO staff in the event of an audit processing failure by setting the "disk_full_action" to "SYSLOG".
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Oracle Linux 8
          Identifier:5416
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:220
          Result:false
          Title:OL08-00-030060 - The OL 8 audit system must take appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full.
          Description:It is critical that when OL 8 is at risk of failing to process audit logs as required, it takes action to mitigate the failure. Audit processing failures include software/hardware errors; failures in the audit capturing mechanisms; and audit storage capacity being reached or exceeded. Responses to audit failure depend on the nature of the failure mode.

          When availability is an overriding concern, other approved actions in response to an audit failure are as follows:

          1) If the failure was caused by the lack of audit record storage capacity, OL 8 must continue generating audit records if possible (automatically restarting the audit service if necessary) and overwriting the oldest audit records in a first-in-first-out manner.

          2) If audit records are sent to a centralized collection server and communication with this server is lost or the server fails, OL 8 must queue audit records locally until communication is restored or until the audit records are retrieved manually. Upon restoration of the connection to the centralized collection server, action should be taken to synchronize the local audit data with the collection server.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audit/auditd.conf: disk_full_action = SYSLOG, SINGLE, or HALT)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:22000 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audit/auditd.conf: disk_full_action = SYSLOG, SINGLE, or HALT
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:22000 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '(?i)^\s*disk_full_action\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:21800 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^syslog$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:21801 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^single$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:21802 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^halt$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-248729 - The OL 8 audit system must audit local events.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248729r779753_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-030061
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: Without establishing what type of events occurred, the source of events, where events occurred, and the outcome of events, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events leading up to an outage or attack.

          Audit record content that may be necessary to satisfy this requirement includes, for example, time stamps, source and destination addresses, user/process identifiers, event descriptions, success/fail indications, filenames involved, and access control or flow control rules invoked. false
          Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to audit local events on the system.

          Add or update the following line in "/etc/audit/auditd.conf" file:

          local_events = yes
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Oracle Linux 8
          Identifier:5416
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:221
          Result:false
          Title:OL08-00-030061 - The OL 8 audit system must audit local events.
          Description:Without establishing what type of events occurred, the source of events, where events occurred, and the outcome of events, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events leading up to an outage or attack.

          Audit record content that may be necessary to satisfy this requirement includes, for example, time stamps, source and destination addresses, user/process identifiers, event descriptions, success/fail indications, filenames involved, and access control or flow control rules invoked.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audit/auditd.conf: local_events = yes)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:22100 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audit/auditd.conf: local_events = yes
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:22100 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '(?i)^\s*local_events\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:22100 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^yes$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-248730 - OL 8 must label all offloaded audit logs before sending them to the central log server.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248730r877390_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-030062
          Identities:CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-4 (1))
          Description: Without establishing what type of events occurred and their source, location, and outcome, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events leading up to an outage or attack.

          Audit record content that may be necessary to satisfy this requirement includes, for example, time stamps, source and destination addresses, user/process identifiers, event descriptions, success/fail indications, filenames involved, and access control or flow control rules invoked.

          Enriched logging is needed to determine who, what, and when events occur on a system. Without this, determining root cause of an event will be much more difficult.

          When audit logs are not labeled before they are sent to a central log server, the audit data will not be able to be analyzed and tied back to the correct system. false
          Fix Text:Edit the "/etc/audit/auditd.conf" file and add or update the "name_format" option:

          name_format = hostname

          The audit daemon must be restarted for changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Oracle Linux 8
          Identifier:5416
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:222
          Result:false
          Title:OL08-00-030062 - OL 8 must label all offloaded audit logs before sending them to the central log server.
          Description:Without establishing what type of events occurred and their source, location, and outcome, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events leading up to an outage or attack.

          Audit record content that may be necessary to satisfy this requirement includes, for example, time stamps, source and destination addresses, user/process identifiers, event descriptions, success/fail indications, filenames involved, and access control or flow control rules invoked.

          Enriched logging is needed to determine who, what, and when events occur on a system. Without this, determining root cause of an event will be much more difficult.

          When audit logs are not labeled before they are sent to a central log server, the audit data will not be able to be analyzed and tied back to the correct system.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audit/auditd.conf: name_format = hostname, fqd or numeric)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:22200 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audit/auditd.conf: name_format = hostname, fqd or numeric
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:22200 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '(?i)^\s*name_format\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:22200 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^hostname$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:22201 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^fqd$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:22202 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^numeric$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-248731 - OL 8 must resolve audit information before writing to disk.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248731r779759_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-030063
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: Without establishing what type of events occurred and their source, location, and outcome, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events leading up to an outage or attack.

          Audit record content that may be necessary to satisfy this requirement includes, for example, time stamps, source and destination addresses, user/process identifiers, event descriptions, success/fail indications, filenames involved, and access control or flow control rules invoked.

          Enriched logging aids in making sense of who, what, and when events occur on a system. Without this, determining root cause of an event will be much more difficult. false
          Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to resolve audit information before writing to disk by adding the following line to the "/etc/audit/auditd.conf" file and add or update the "log_format" option:

          log_format = ENRICHED

          The audit daemon must be restarted for changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Oracle Linux 8
          Identifier:5416
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:223
          Result:false
          Title:OL08-00-030063 - OL 8 must resolve audit information before writing to disk.
          Description:Without establishing what type of events occurred and their source, location, and outcome, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events leading up to an outage or attack.

          Audit record content that may be necessary to satisfy this requirement includes, for example, time stamps, source and destination addresses, user/process identifiers, event descriptions, success/fail indications, filenames involved, and access control or flow control rules invoked.

          Enriched logging aids in making sense of who, what, and when events occur on a system. Without this, determining root cause of an event will be much more difficult.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audit/auditd.conf: name_format = enriched)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:22300 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audit/auditd.conf: name_format = enriched
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:22300 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '(?i)^\s*log_format\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:22300 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^enriched$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-248732 - OL 8 audit logs must have a mode of "0600" or less permissive to prevent unauthorized read access.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248732r779762_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:OL08-00-030070
          Identities:CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
          CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
          CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
          Description: Unauthorized disclosure of audit records can reveal system and configuration data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality.

          Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit OL 8 activity.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029 false
          Fix Text:Configure the audit log to be protected from unauthorized read access by setting the correct permissive mode with the following command:

          $ sudo chmod 0600 [audit_log_file]

          Replace "[audit_log_file]" to the correct audit log path. By default, this location is "/var/log/audit/audit.log".
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Oracle Linux 8
          Identifier:5416
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8os:def:248732
          Result:false
          Title:OL08-00-030070 - OL 8 audit logs must have a mode of "0600" or less permissive to prevent unauthorized read access.
          Description:Unauthorized disclosure of audit records can reveal system and configuration data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality.

          Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit OL 8 activity.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (Audit log is mode 0600 or less permissive)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.unix:tst:23039600 (file_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Audit log is mode 0600 or less permissive
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.unix:obj:20000011 (file_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • for filepath, the following must be true:
            State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.unix:ste:20000004 (file_state)
            State Requirements:
            • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', suid must be equal to 'false'
            • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sgid must be equal to 'false'
            • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sticky must be equal to 'false'
            • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', uexec must be equal to 'false'
            • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', gread must be equal to 'false'
            • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', gwrite must be equal to 'false'
            • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', gexec must be equal to 'false'
            • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', oread must be equal to 'false'
            • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', owrite must be equal to 'false'
            • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', oexec must be equal to 'false'
            Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

            V-248733 - OL 8 audit logs must be owned by root to prevent unauthorized read access.

              V-248734 - OL 8 audit logs must be group-owned by root to prevent unauthorized read access.

              Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248734r779768_rule
              Test Type:Automated
              Result:Fail
              Version:OL08-00-030090
              Identities:CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
              CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
              CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
              Description: Unauthorized disclosure of audit records can reveal system and configuration data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality.

              Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit OL 8 activity.

              Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029 false
              Fix Text:Configure the audit log to be protected from unauthorized read access by setting the correct group-owner as "root" with the following command:

              $ sudo chgrp root [audit_log_file]

              Replace "[audit_log_file]" to the correct audit log path. By default, this location is "/var/log/audit/audit.log".

              Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit OL 8 activity.

                V-248735 - The OL 8 audit log directory must be owned by root to prevent unauthorized read access.

                $ sudo chown root [audit_log_directory]

                    V-248737 - The OL 8 audit log directory must have a mode of 0700 or less permissive to prevent unauthorized read access.

                    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248737r779777_rule
                    Test Type:Automated
                    Result:Fail
                    Version:OL08-00-030120
                    Identities:CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
                    CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
                    CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
                    Description: Unauthorized disclosure of audit records can reveal system and configuration data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality.

                    Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit OL 8 system activity.

                    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029 false
                    Fix Text:Configure the audit log directory to be protected from unauthorized read access by setting the correct permissive mode with the following command:

                    $ sudo chmod 0700 [audit_log_directory]

                    Replace "[audit_log_directory]" to the correct audit log directory path. By default, this location is "/var/log/audit".
                    Severity:medium
                    Weight:10.0
                    Reference:
                    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                    Publisher:DISA
                    Type:DPMS Target
                    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                    Identifier:5416
                    Definitions:
                    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:229
                    Result:false
                    Title:OL08-00-030120 - The OL 8 audit log directory must have a mode of 0700 or less permissive to prevent unauthorized read access.
                    Description:Unauthorized disclosure of audit records can reveal system and configuration data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality.

                    Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit OL 8 system activity.

                    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029
                    Class:compliance
                    Tests:
                    • false (All child checks must be true.)
                      • false (audit log directory has a mode of 0700 or less permissive.)
                    Tests:
                    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:22900 (file_test)
                    Result:false
                    Title:audit log directory has a mode of 0700 or less permissive.
                    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:22900 (file_object)
                    Object Requirements:
                    • for path, the following must be true:
                      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:22900 (file_state)
                      State Requirements:
                      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', suid must be equal to 'false'
                      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sgid must be equal to 'false'
                      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sticky must be equal to 'false'
                      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', gread must be equal to 'false'
                      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', gwrite must be equal to 'false'
                      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', gexec must be equal to 'false'
                      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', oread must be equal to 'false'
                      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', owrite must be equal to 'false'
                      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', oexec must be equal to 'false'
                      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                      V-248738 - The OL 8 audit system must protect auditing rules from unauthorized change.

                      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248738r779780_rule
                      Test Type:Automated
                      Result:Fail
                      Version:OL08-00-030121
                      Identities:CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
                      CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
                      CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
                      Description: Unauthorized disclosure of audit records can reveal system and configuration data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality.

                      Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit OL 8 system activity.

                      In immutable mode, unauthorized users cannot execute changes to the audit system to potentially hide malicious activity and then put the audit rules back. A system reboot would be noticeable and a system administrator could then investigate the unauthorized changes.

                      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029 false
                      Fix Text:Configure the audit system to set the audit rules to be immutable by adding the following line to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

                      -e 2

                      Note: Once set, the system must be rebooted for auditing to be changed. It is recommended to add this option as the last step in securing the system.
                      Severity:medium
                      Weight:10.0
                      Reference:
                      Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                      Publisher:DISA
                      Type:DPMS Target
                      Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                      Identifier:5416
                      Definitions:
                      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:230
                      Result:false
                      Title:OL08-00-030121 - The OL 8 audit system must protect auditing rules from unauthorized change.
                      Description:Unauthorized disclosure of audit records can reveal system and configuration data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality.

                      Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit OL 8 system activity.

                      In immutable mode, unauthorized users cannot execute changes to the audit system to potentially hide malicious activity and then put the audit rules back. A system reboot would be noticeable and a system administrator could then investigate the unauthorized changes.

                      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029
                      Class:compliance
                      Tests:
                      • false (All child checks must be true.)
                        • false (/etc/audit/audit.rules: -e 2 option is present and is the last line in the file.)
                      Tests:
                      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:23000 (textfilecontent54_test)
                      Result:false
                      Title:/etc/audit/audit.rules: -e 2 option is present and is the last line in the file.
                      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:23000 (textfilecontent54_object)
                      Object Requirements:
                      • behavior requirements:
                        • multiline = false
                      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                      • pattern must match the pattern '\n[ \t]*-e[ \t]+2\s*$'
                      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                      V-248739 - The OL 8 audit system must protect logon UIDs from unauthorized change.

                      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248739r779783_rule
                      Test Type:Automated
                      Result:Fail
                      Version:OL08-00-030122
                      Identities:CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
                      CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
                      CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
                      Description: Unauthorized disclosure of audit records can reveal system and configuration data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality.

                      Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit OL 8 system activity.

                      In immutable mode, unauthorized users cannot execute changes to the audit system to potentially hide malicious activity and then put the audit rules back. A system reboot would be noticeable and a system administrator could then investigate the unauthorized changes.

                      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029 false
                      Fix Text:Configure the audit system to set the logon UIDs to be immutable by adding the following line to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

                      --loginuid-immutable
                      Severity:medium
                      Weight:10.0
                      Reference:

                      Publisher:DISA
                      Type:DPMS Target
                      Subject:Oracle Linux 8

                      Result:false

                      Description:Unauthorized disclosure of audit records can reveal system and configuration data to attackers, thus compromising its confidentiality.

                      Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, audit reports) needed to successfully audit OL 8 system activity.

                      In immutable mode, unauthorized users cannot execute changes to the audit system to potentially hide malicious activity and then put the audit rules back. A system reboot would be noticeable and a system administrator could then investigate the unauthorized changes.

                      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029

                        • false (/etc/audit/audit.rules: --loginuid-immutable option is present.)

                      • pattern must match the pattern '^--loginuid-immutable$'
                      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

                      V-248740 - OL 8 must generate audit records for all account creation events that affect "/etc/shadow".

                      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248740r853796_rule
                      Test Type:Automated
                      Result:Fail
                      Version:OL08-00-030130
                      Identities:CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                      CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                      CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                      CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                      CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                      CCI-001404 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                      CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                      CCI-002132 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
                      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                      Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                      Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

                      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
                      Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to generate audit records for all account creations events that affect "/etc/shadow".

                      Add or update the following file system rule to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

                      -w /etc/shadow -p wa -k identity

                      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                      $ sudo service auditd restart
                      Severity:medium
                      Weight:10.0
                      Reference:
                      Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                      Publisher:DISA
                      Type:DPMS Target
                      Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                      Identifier:5416
                      Definitions:
                      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:232
                      Result:false
                      Title:OL08-00-030130 - OL 8 must generate audit records for all account creation events that affect "/etc/shadow".
                      Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                      Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

                      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221
                      Class:compliance
                      Tests:
                      • false (All child checks must be true.)
                        • false (Audit modifications to /etc/audit/audit.rules.)
                      Tests:
                      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:23200 (textfilecontent54_test)
                      Result:false
                      Title:Audit modifications to /etc/audit/audit.rules.
                      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:23200 (textfilecontent54_object)
                      Object Requirements:
                      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                      • for pattern, the following must be true:
                        • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-w\s+/etc/shadow(?:\s+-p\s+(?:[rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*))?(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
                      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                        • false (Audit modifications to /etc/passwd.)
                      Tests:
                      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:23400 (textfilecontent54_test)
                      Result:false
                      Title:Audit modifications to /etc/passwd.
                      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:23400 (textfilecontent54_object)
                      Object Requirements:
                      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                      • for pattern, the following must be true:
                        • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-w\s+/etc/passwd(?:\s+-p\s+(?:[rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*))?(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
                      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                      V-248743 - OL 8 must generate audit records for all account creation events that affect "/etc/gshadow".

                      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248743r853799_rule
                      Test Type:Automated
                      Result:Fail
                      Version:OL08-00-030160
                      Identities:CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                      CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                      CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                      CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)

                      CCI-001404 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                      CCI-001405 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                      CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                      CCI-002132 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
                      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                      Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                      Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

                      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
                      Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to generate audit records for all account creations events that affect "/etc/gshadow".

                      Add or update the following file system rule to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

                      -w /etc/gshadow -p wa -k identity

                      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                      $ sudo service auditd restart
